snippet: A man who pleaded guilty to killing a Border Patrol agent whose death exposed a botched federal gun-smuggling operation was sentenced on Monday to 27 years in prison.
abstract: Rosario Rafael Burboa-Alvarez receives 27 years in prison for co-conspiring from Mexico in 2010 shooting of Phoenix Border Patrol Agent Brian Terry in Arizona; death of Agent Terry revealed failed federal gun-smuggling operation.

keywords.value: Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: A man who pleaded guilty to killing a Border Patrol agent whose death exposed a botched federal gun-smuggling operation was sentenced on Monday to 27 years in prison.

headline.print_headline: Arizona: Man Gets 27 Years in Border Agent’s Death
headline.main: Arizona: Man Gets 27 Years in Border Agent’s Death
